711393f-a.text:
245 and 243 East 17th Street, (right to left), adjoining and west of the N.W. corner of Second Ave., showing at No. 243, the home of Surrogate James A. Foley; a leading figure in Tammany Hall. On the right, at the corner, appears a portion of the Manhattan General Hospital (former Lying-In Hospital).
September 18, 1937
George D. Chinn.

711392f-a.text:
West 17th Street, north side, east of Second Avenue, showing a corner of Stuyvesent (sic) Square Park and Manhattan General Hospital in background.
July 18, 1939
P.L. Sperr

707793f-a.text:
Second Avenue, west side, from East 17th to 18th Streets, showing a southwestward view of Manhattan General Hospital. This structure, erected on the Hon. Hamilton Fish home site, was formerly occupied by the Lying In Hospital. At the left is the westerly portion of Stuyvesant Park below 17th Street.
April 26, 1940
George D. Chinn

The Manhattan General Hospital, here shown, is the former Lying In Hospital.  The building is the same, only the name was changed.

1558137.title: 315 East 17th Street (First Avenue - Second Avenue)
1558137.folder: 315 East 17th Street (First Avenue - Second Avenue), Manhattan, NY

711391f-a.text:
309 to 319 East 17th Street, north side, east of Second Ave., showing prominently the home of Charles Murphy (No. 309, left) former leader of Tammany Hall.
September 1937.
George D. Chinn.

1508681-a.title: Second Avenue - 17th Street - E18th Street
1508681-a.folder: Second Avenue - 17th Street - E18th Street, Manhattan, NY
